> I agree in the case of Sebastiens proposal. All i=B4m proposing, is to=

> =
convention.
>

e web: I can
> introduce new media types based on existing ones.


You can =
already base a media type on an existing one by documenting that in
it's sp=
ecification


> Any client, e.g. a browser, being aware of the "hierachical=
 media type"
> concept could render a "application/contact+xhtml+xml" as us=
ual (if he has
> no clue what contact+html is) or could do something useful=
 with it. For
> example, providing the user a popup with "Do you want to ad=
d this contact to
> your address book?".
>

You don't need a media type ide=
ntifier to do this, you should do it by
standardising a link relation e.g. =
rel=3D"contact"

Cheers,
Mike
